briefTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, 3-parallel-group Comparison Trial to Investigate the Effect of Nalmefene on Alcohol Consumption Reduction in Patients With Alcohol Dependence (Phase 3 Trial)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Japanese males and females aged 20 or above who have signed the informed consent form
* The patient has alcohol dependence, diagnosed according to Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition, Text Revision (DSM-IV-TR) and confirmed by Mini-international Neuropsychiatric Interview (M. I. N. I.)
* The patient has a drinking risk level of High or above (\> 60 g for men and \> 40 g for women) both at the Screening Visit and at the Randomization Visit .

Exclusion Criteria:

* The patient with a current diagnosis or history of substance use disorders (except for alcohol, nicotine, and caffeine), according to DSM-IV-TR and confirmed by M. I. N. I.
* The patient has reported current use of, or has tested positive for, drugs of abuse (opiates, methadone, cocaine, amphetamines, barbiturates) at the screening test

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in the Number of Heavy Drinking Days (HDDs) From Baseline at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of HDDs is defined as the number of days per month \[days/month\] with alcohol consumption of \> 60 g for males and \> 40 g for females

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in the Number of Heavy Drinking Days (HDDs) From Baseline at Week 24
Change in Total Alcohol Consumption (TAC) From Baseline at Week 12
Change in Total Alcohol Consumption (TAC) From Baseline at Week 24
Response Shift Drinking Risk Level (RSDRL) at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of patients with a downward shift in drinking risk level of two categories or more

outcomeMeasures.title: Response Shift Drinking Risk Level (RSDRL) at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of patients with a downward shift in drinking risk level of two categories or more

outcomeMeasures.title: Response Low Drinking Risk Level (RLDRL) at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of patients with low or lower drinking risk level

outcomeMeasures.title: Response Low Drinking Risk Level (RLDRL) at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of patients with low or lower drinking risk level

outcomeMeasures.title: 70% TAC Responder Rate at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of patients with a 70% decrease in TAC

outcomeMeasures.title: 70% TAC Responder Rate at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of patients with a 70% decrease in TAC

outcomeMeasures.title: HDD Responder Rate at Week 12
HDD Responder Rate at Week 24
Change in CGI-S From Baseline at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: The CGI-S scale was used by clinicians when assessing their global impression of a patient's current clinical condition. The investigator or subinvestigator used his/her clinical experience with this patient population to rate the severity of a subject's clinical condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (Normal, not at all ill) to 7 (Among the most extremely ill patients).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in CGI-S From Baseline at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: The CGI-S scale was used by clinicians when assessing their global impression of a patient's current clinical condition. The investigator or subinvestigator used his/her clinical experience with this patient population to rate the severity of a subject's clinical condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (Normal, not at all ill) to 7 (Among the most extremely ill patients).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in CGI-I From Baseline at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: The CGI-I scale is used to assess a patient's improvement (or worsening). The investigator or subinvestigator assesses a subject's condition relative to baseline on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (Very much improved) to 7 (Very much worse).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in CGI-I From Baseline at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: The CGI-I scale was used to assess a patient's improvement (or worsening). The investigator or subinvestigator assesses a subject's condition relative to baseline on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (Very much improved) to 7 (Very much worse).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Logarithm Scale in Serum γ-glutamyltransferase From Baseline at Week 12
Change in Logarithm Scale in Serum γ-glutamyltransferase From Baseline at Week 24
Change in Logarithm Scale in Serum Alanine Aminotransferase From Baseline at Week 12
Change in Logarithm Scale in Serum Alanine Aminotransferase From Baseline at Week 24
